learning_objective: Distribute tasks and maintain a project timeline when collaboratively developing computational artifacts.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex and their classmates are programming an emergency preparedness application that includes a First Aid guide. They have to divide the modules among their teammates and maintain a project timeline for effective development. Which of the following is the BEST strategy for Alex and their team to follow?",
    "Answer1": "Assign all the modules to the most skilled programmer and let them finish the project alone",
    "Answer2": "Alex should take over the entire project to ensure that nothing goes wrong",
    "Answer3": "Divide the modules evenly among the team and assign a timeline in which each module needs to be completed",
    "Answer4": "Implement all modules at once without any planning or organization",
    "CorrectAnswer": "3",
    "Explanation": "In a collaborative programming project, dividing tasks evenly and maintaining a timeline helps to ensure an organized approach to developing computational artefacts. It also ensures that all team members contribute equally to the project."
}
